meanings.definition: A piece of material suspended at the top to form a covering or screen, typically one of a pair at a window.
meanings.sent1: The curtain blocked the sunlight from entering the room.
meanings.sent2: She opened the curtain to let in some fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the curtain and ended up tangled in it.
meanings.sent4: As the curtain fell, it revealed a breathtaking view of the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The velvet curtain felt soft to the touch and added elegance to the room.

meanings.sent1: The heavy rain acted as a curtain, obscuring the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The curtain of fog made it difficult to see the path ahead.
meanings.sent3: The curtain of secrecy surrounding the project piqued everyone's curiosity.
meanings.sent4: The curtain of silence fell over the room as they waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The curtain of trees shielded the house from the strong winds.
